subject: Web3
title: Crypto-Collateralized Stablecoins
description: Learn Crypto-Collateralized Stablecoins in one minute.

hook.text: What if a stablecoin was backed by other crypto instead of dollars? That's how DAI works.

buildup.text: Users lock up Ethereum worth more than the stablecoins they receive. Overcollateralization absorbs price swings.

discovery.text: To mint $100 of DAI, you might need to lock $150 of Ethereum. The extra cushion keeps the peg safe.

twist.text: If the collateral's value drops too far, it's automatically liquidated. In a crash, borrowers lose their deposits.

climax.text: Crypto-backed stablecoins are more decentralized but less capital efficient. Freedom comes with complexity.

punchline.text: Lock up $150 in crypto to get $100 in stablecoins. Decentralized stability has a cost.

quiz.question: Why are crypto-collateralized stablecoins overcollateralized?
options: Extra collateral absorbs crypto price swings and protects the peg
